trans-unit.source: Specifies how client-side JavaScript is generated to initiate a postback event.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.PostBackOptions> class allows controls to emit client-side script that initiates a postback event.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.PostBackOptions> class also provides a reference to the control that initiated the postback event through the <xref:System.Web.UI.PostBackOptions.TargetControl%2A> property.

The postback event is created based on the options specified in the <xref:System.Web.UI.PostBackOptions> object passed in to the <xref:System.Web.UI.ClientScriptManager.GetPostBackEventReference%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
Normally, a postback to the server is initiated by elements such as a Submit button or an Image button.
However, by emitting client-side JavaScript, different controls can initiate a postback event.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.PostBackOptions"></xref> class with the specified target control data.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control"></xref> that receives the postback event.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.PostBackOptions"></xref> class with the specified target control and argument data.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control"></xref> that receives the postback event.
The optional parameter passed during the postback event.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.PostBackOptions"></xref> class with the specified values for the instance's properties.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control"></xref> that receives the postback event.
The optional parameter passed during the postback event.
The target of the postback.
`true` to automatically post the form back to the server in response to a user action; otherwise, `false`.
`true` if the `javascript:` prefix is required; otherwise, `false`.
`true` if the postback event should return the page to the current scroll position and return focus to the target control; otherwise, `false`.
`true` if the postback event can be raised by client script; otherwise, `false`.
`true` if client-side validation is required before the postback event occurs; otherwise, `false`.
The group of controls for which <xref href="System.Web.UI.PostBackOptions"></xref> causes validation when it posts back to the server.
targetControl is `null`.
Gets or sets the target URL for the postback of a Web Forms page.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.PostBackOptions.ActionUrl%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.PostBackOptions> class specifies the URL for the `action` attribute of a Web Forms page.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.PostBackOptions.ActionUrl%2A> property can be used to specify which Web Forms page to post data back to, causing a cross-page post.
For more information on cross-page posting, see [Cross-Page Posting in ASP.NET Web Forms](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/fedf234e-b7c4-4644-a9e8-c1c0870b043b).
The URL for the postback of a Web Forms page.
The default value is an empty string ("").
Gets or sets an optional argument that is transferred in the postback event.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.PostBackOptions.Argument%2A> property specifies an optional argument that is transferred in a postback event.
This property is used to represent the `EVENTARGUMENT` parameter of the _`doPostBack` method of the client-side JavaScript.
The optional argument that is transferred in the postback event.
The default value is an empty string ("").
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the form will automatically post back to the server in response to a user action.

You can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.PostBackOptions.AutoPostBack%2A> property to indicate that a Web Forms page should automatically post back to the server in response to a user action such as selecting an item from a drop-down list.
The JavaScript `setTimeout` method is used with the _`doPostBack` method to ensure that the user action completes before the postback occurs.
`true` if the form will automatically post back in response to a user action; otherwise, `false`.
The default value is `false`.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the postback event should occur from client-side script.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.PostBackOptions.ClientSubmit%2A> property indicates whether the postback event should occur from client-side script.
If you set the <xref:System.Web.UI.PostBackOptions.ClientSubmit%2A> property to `false`, then no JavaScript is generated.
You might assign `false` to the <xref:System.Web.UI.PostBackOptions.ClientSubmit%2A> property if you want to call the `__doPostBack` method yourself.
`true` if the postback event should occur from client-side script; otherwise, `false`.
The default value is `true`.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether client-side validation is required before the postback event occurs.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.PostBackOptions.PerformValidation%2A> property is used to specify whether client-side validation is required before the postback event can occur.

When the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.PostBackOptions.PerformValidation%2A> property is set to `true`, you can also use the <xref:System.Web.UI.PostBackOptions.ValidationGroup%2A> property to specify the name of the validation group for which validation is required before the postback event occurs.
`true` if client-side validation is required before the postback event occurs; otherwise, `false`.
The default value is `false`.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the `javascript:` prefix is generated for the client-side script.
The `javascript:` prefix is needed with some HTML attributes such as the `href` attribute of the `<a>` tag to distinguish a JavaScript property from a URL.
An attribute like `onclick` does not need the `javascript:` prefix because it is automatically associated with JavaScript.
`true` if the `javascript:` prefix is generated for the client-side script; otherwise, `false`.
The default value is `true`.
Gets the control target that receives the postback event.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.PostBackOptions.TargetControl%2A> property returns a <xref:System.Web.UI.Control> object that represents the control that receives the postback event.
This property is passed as the `EVENTTARGET` parameter to the `__doPostBack` method of the client-side JavaScript.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control"></xref> that represents the control that receives the postback event.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the postback event should return the page to the current scroll position and return focus to the current control.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.PostBackOptions.TrackFocus%2A> property indicates whether the postback event should return the page to the current scroll position and return focus to the <xref:System.Web.UI.PostBackOptions.TargetControl%2A> control after the postback event has occurred.
`true` if the postback event should return the page to the current scroll position and return focus to the target control; otherwise, `false`.
The default value is `false`.
Gets or sets the group of controls for which the <xref href="System.Web.UI.PostBackOptions"></xref> object causes validation when it posts back to the server.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.PostBackOptions.ValidationGroup%2A> property to specify the validation group to validate when a postback event is generated.
Only the validation controls in the specified validation group are validated.
The group of controls for which the <xref href="System.Web.UI.PostBackOptions"></xref> object causes validation when it posts back to the server.
The default value is an empty string ("").
